Clients.OffLineTool
Class AlmaStatus

java.lang.Object
  Clients.ACSClient
      Clients.OffLineTool.AlmaStatus

public class AlmaStatus
extends ACSClient

This class is responsible to "calculate" the Alma status based on the Sub systems status, thats why on the constructor receive a SubsystemsStatus instance. The algorithm to get the status of Alma software was copied from runOMC but is implemented on another way, to calculate the status of alma software, this class obtain the status of each subsystem, the algorithm is the following: 1) If any status is on error, then Alma is on error 2) If any status is on unavailable, then alma is on unavailable 3) If all status are on shutdown, then alma is on shutdown 4) If all status are on operational, then alma is on operational 5) If All status are on online or operational, the alma status is starting 6) If all status are on initializing or shutdown or online or operational, then is starting 7) If all status are on shutting down or preshutdown or shutdown or operational, then the alma status is stopping 8) For any another combination, the alma status is transiting

Author:
Andres Villalobos, 2011 Summerjob, Ingenieria de ejecucion en Computacion e Informatica, Universidad Catolica del norte

Method Detail

getStatus

public java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> getStatus()
This is the implementation of getStatus, here a linked list is generated with the status of alma software on JSON format

Specified by:
getStatus in class ACSClient
Returns:
A linked list containing the Alma status, those could be:
  • {\"Type\":\"AlmaStatus\",\"Status\":\"ERROR"\"}
  • {\"Type\":\"AlmaStatus\",\"Status\":\"UNAVAILABLE"\"}
  • {\"Type\":\"AlmaStatus\",\"Status\":\"SHUTDOWN"\"}
  • {\"Type\":\"AlmaStatus\",\"Status\":\"OPERATIONAL"\"}
  • {\"Type\":\"AlmaStatus\",\"Status\":\"STARTING"\"}
  • {\"Type\":\"AlmaStatus\",\"Status\":\"STOPPING"\"}
  • {\"Type\":\"AlmaStatus\",\"Status\":\"TRANSITING"\"}

    • calculateStatus

    public java.lang.String calculateStatus()
    This method return the status of alma software depending of subystems status, the algorithm is explained on the class definition

    Returns:
    A string indicating the alma status, those could be:
  • ERROR
  • UNAVAILABLE
  • SHUTDOWN
  • OPERATIONAL
  • STARTING
  • STOPPING
  • TRANSITING
